data.title: Missing API on ReactEditorView
data.body:
@nathansobo: As discussed on Campfire I'll try to list the missing methods/properties/elements on the `ReactEditorView` class. This is not exhaustive, maybe others can help filling the holes here.

On the editor view itself: 
- [ ] `overlayer` div and outlet are missing (which I use on abe33/atom-color-highlight, but I've already wrote a workaround), where`underlayer` point to `.selections` (and as far as I can tell the `highlight-selected` package by @richrace fail to append markers in it)
- [ ] `scrollView` outlet is missing.
- [x] `getModel` is missing. (on #2423)
- [ ] `getFontSize` is missing. 
- [ ] `buildLineElementsForScreenRows` and others line building methods are missing, but are probably the part of the problem behind the changes to React, so...

On the gutter: 
- [ ] `getLineNumberElement` is missing (breaks coffee-lint by @dotcypress)

data.title: Strange double cursor when using split panes
data.body:
After splitting right, I tried to edit the file and my changes were added to both my old cursor location in the file in the new pane and my new cursor location in the same file in the old pane. Even when I clicked to focus in one pane, the old cursor would disappear but the changes still were still made in both.

I'm running on Linux.

data.title: Cursor sometimes getting frozen
data.body:
Occasionally, my cursor will visually, but not effectively, lock up.  Arrow keys will not move it, nor will clicking.  Click-dragging will.

After clicking/using arrow keys, typing will occur text to appear in the correct location.

This state persists when switching windows, frames, etc.

Haven't discovered what causes this state, and no errors occur on the console.  Reopening the project resolves it.

data.title: Make react the default editor
data.body:
This will make react the default editor.

All issues related to the react editor: https://github.com/atom/atom/issues?labels=react-editor-bug
## Todo

These are the blockers to releasing the react editor as the default
- [ ] Do a pass on React updates and see if we can boost cursor and text insertion performance
## Completed Tasks
- [x] Show code folding markers in gutter #1984 #2464
- [x] Shift + Backspace renders deleted characters #2159 
- [x] Lines sometimes duplicated or not removed #2429
- [x] Make autocomplete-plus work with the react editor #2318
- [x] Fix broken context menus #2442
- [x] Missing API on ReactEditorView #2428 (PR #2497)
- [x] React editor cannot open this file  bug react-editor #2392 
- [x] Closing find occasionally causes buffer rendering issues #2237 
- [x] Get the build green with react turned on in specs
- [x] Fix selection problems #2459
- [x] Fix problems with spellcheck #2460
- [x] Fix issues with find and replace atom/find-and-replace#232
- [x] Scroll speed is too fast
- [x] Selections become hidden behind tool-panels #2578 
- [x] Add back IME composition events 184068dc55d2cc2f3aaa9e43c7aa9aa54946b53d
- [x] Add highlight decorations #2605 
- [x] Gutter styles don't extend to the bottom of the editor #2596 
- [x] With React editor turned on line numbers are always on #2707 
- [x] Decorations not updated when markers move #2705 #2727 
- [x] ctrl+click to add a cursor doesn't work on linux #2105 
- [x] ReactEditorView has no method resetDisplay #2674 
- [x] Mouse selection seems to be off-by-one in React Editor #2668
- [x] Editor scroll width is miscalculated when longest line has variable-width characters #2666 
- [x] Cursor line highlights don't go full width and show with selections #2701 #2757  
- [x] Create blog post about the React Editor change atom/blog.atom.io#48
- [x] Soft wrap issues #2842 #2844 
- [x] Character widths aren't invalidated when stylesheets are changed #2845 
- [x] Not autoscrolling when cursor moves due to undo #2815
- [x] Indent guide is wrong #2367
- [x] Update the decoration API #2819
- [x] Characters are measured as 0 width when editor is hidden during theme change #2856 
- [x] Accent circonflexe removes previous char #2716 
- [x] End-of-line invisibles not visible on empty lines with indent guides in React editor #2857
- [x] Scrolling is sluggish when there a large numbers of folds #2848 
## Fixes these issues

Fixes #2443
Fixes #1850
Fixes #1790 
Fixes #1711
Fixes #2778
Fixes #2764
Fixed #2710 
Fixed #2785
Fixed atom/find-and-replace#245
Fixes #2375

data.title: Can't move down: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'length' of undefined
data.body:
I get this error when trying to move around in either very long files or a short file with one very long line.

Currently, I was searching through a .js file with thousands of lines in it. I would search on something, and after finding it, would navigate down a few lines. I was using 'j' in vim-mode to move down one line at a time, but the problem happens when using the arrow keys too.

When a search brought me to line 5279, I was not able to move down anymore using the arrow key or 'j'. As I was testing out other direction keys, that's when this error came up. I tried restarting Atom, and again as I tried to move around, I got this error. I remember getting this error a few days ago on a one-line file that had an extremely long line in it.

After restarting a 2nd time, I still can't move down past line 5279 with the arrow key or 'j', and I also can't move to the right, but I can move up and to the left. I'm not getting the error any more, but it's broken.

I can still navigate using the mouse scroll wheel and clicking on a lower location, but down and right movements from the keyboard still don't work.

data.title: TokenizedLine::isComment returns the wrong value for javascript blockquotes
data.body:
### Steps to reproduce
1. Make sure Atom's soft-tabs configuration option is off (we want to insert hard tabs)
2. Clone git@github.com:iandotkelly/atomissue.git and open `sample.js`
3. Insert a new line at the end of the file and press tab.

You expect a hard tab to be inserted, but a soft tab is inserted. This is because `TokenizedLine::isComment` returns false for the first and second lines of the file.

**moved from https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/issues/11**

data.title: Atom Office Hours May 28th 2014
data.body:
:point_right:  :school: :clock10: :office: :point_left: 

The Atom team will be hosting open office hours tomorrow. This is a great way to ask questions, report bugs, and discuss packages. Feel free to hop into the chat room anytime during the 90 minute scheduled time.
- **When**: May 28th 2014 from 10:00 - 11:30 AM Pacific Daylight Time, 17:00- 18:30 UTC [Your time zone](http://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=Atom+Office+Hours&iso=20140528T10&p1=224&ah=1&am=30)
- **Where**: Atom Office Hours Campfire https://githubtraining.campfirenow.com/2f805
- **Whom**: @kevinsawicki, @nathansobo, @probablycorey, @thedaniel
- **Cost**: Free, no registration required

Feel free to comment here if there any specific things you want to discuss ahead of time or if you want to mention if you will be attending just so we have a rough head count.

We plan on doing more of these in the near future so if you can't make it tomorrow don't worry. :city_sunrise:

data.title: How to write spec with binary atom on Windows
data.body:
I am using @alfredxing 's [Windows atom release](https://github.com/alfredxing/atom/releases). It works perfectly.

While using an atom plugin, I find a bug, and try to fix it. Well, everything is OK. The next step, I want to write some specs for my code. I follow the guide [here](https://atom.io/docs/v0.99.0/writing-specs).

Because the atom plugin need an [Edit](https://atom.io/docs/api/v0.99.0/api/classes/Editor.html) instance, I have two options:
1. Use the one under existing `atom.workspace`, which is a global variable
2. Or, create a new empty instance using `Editor` class under `src/editor.coffee`

I choose the second option. So I download the atom source code (before this step, I am using atom binary without source code). And, use `require` to import the `Editor` class. But I get some error about some packages are missing. It seems, I need to run `npm install` in atom source code folder.

What `npm install` does is to compile the atom. But, I already have the binary atom, and I just want to make a new `Editor` class!

So, I think that is something wrong. Does anybody have ideas on how to fix this?

Thanks!

data.title: Replace form doesn't resize
data.body: Pasting very large contents into the replace form destroys the layout. The form does only grow but never shrink.

data.title: Pane:Show Next Item Disappears In Settings Page
data.body:
With the settings page open, if the "Settings" or "Themes" section is selected, "pane: show next item" (ctrl+tab), the command to switch between open documents, is broken. It works as expected if the "Keybindings" or "Packages" section is selected, but not for "Settings" or "Themes".

Expected output (shown with "Keybindings" selected):
![atom expected view](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7651077/3093462/c473a946-e5b2-11e3-82e5-19bc857cc8f9.png)

Output with "Settings" or "Themes" sections selected:
![atom unexpected view](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7651077/3093466/cd8fb0d8-e5b2-11e3-820d-5194ef9f1f2a.png)

Interestingly, show next item works when you first select the "Settings" or "Themes" sections, but will disappear if you cycle back to it. Also, if you take focus away from the Settings page (the entire page, not just the "Settings" section) by clicking on another file or switching to another program on your computer, returning to the Settings page brings back the show next item command. Clicking the Settings tab at the top of the screen (again, for the entire settings page, not just the settings section) also brings the functionality back.
![atom after clicking settings](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7651077/3093584/08ab6b20-e5b4-11e3-9a82-e695891b2b09.png)

I am using version 0.110.0-00987f3 on Windows 7 here on my work computer. I installed Atom through [alfredxing's](https://github.com/alfredxing/atom/releases/) installer because I could not install all of the dependencies needed to build it myself, so this may be an issue only present in this installation.

data.title: [Windows] Version in Help menu not updating
data.body:
After building b5bff9f8b8d31fafc4949f8708de608acf7497c6 and clicking `Help`:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1251005/3093529/88eb7a60-e5b3-11e3-82ad-1a5edf2bcb13.png)

The version has not been incremented -- the most recent version is [0.99.0](https://github.com/atom/atom/releases).

data.title: [Windows] LICENSE.md is not in the correct location.
data.body:
When clicking `Help -> View License`:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1251005/3093447/8e1f8e82-e5b2-11e3-958e-6826a026ecc0.png)

Atom opens up a new editor pane with the path:
`c:\Program Files (x86)\Atom\resources\app\LICENSE.md`

After a fresh installation, `LICENSE.md` is not there -- instead it's sitting in `C:\Program Files (x86)\Atom`.  If I copy the file into place manually, it works.

data.title: Package manager should allow dependencies to be placed on other plugins
data.body:
Currently, packages that are pluggable (such as autocomplete-plus, and AtomLinter) are dependent on their own implementations of plugin style functionality.  In order to better support packages like this I think that we should be able to support packages having dependencies.  

What I would like to see is capabilities added for the following.
- Subscribe to package manager to get instance of package when it is loaded
- When loaded a subscribed package should expose instance of package created so sub modules can execute against loaded package, for instance if the workspace was a separate module we would get the workspace by subscribing to the workspace load rather than it being available globally on the atom object.
- Ability to subscribe to loaded packages by metadata filter, something like what atom linter does to find linters that have been loaded, but subscribed like we subscribe to all current and future editors.
- A simple interface for verifying version (via semver) of the subscribed package(s) are of the correct version, and when not alerting the user that the modules need updating.

This would give us the ability to dynamically, and bi-directionally link modules to each other.

data.title: Wrong line width calculation on unicode characters
data.body:
Atom seems to calculate line width of Unicode characters incorrectly. The following is the result of atom 0.95 on Fedora 20,
![2014-05-26 21 07 16](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/32396/3082659/d16b7e80-e4d6-11e3-8272-8a365a776d49.png)
The following is the result of vim 7.4 on Fedora,
![2014-05-26 21 08 30](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/32396/3082668/fe22a494-e4d6-11e3-8b26-e84289022665.png)
It shows that atom calculated the wrong display width.

The same problem is reported in the forum by ZhangHanDong and more investigation into the problem is offered by Blaisorblade at [Forum](http://discuss.atom.io/t/preferred-line-length-dont-support-chinese/4666)

data.title: Load from network
data.body:
I'm in a LAN, with last windows build from http://atom.someguy123.com/#sthash.eU1lJdcA.dpbs

System is a Windows7 x64.

If I open a local file (desktop for example) loads correctly the file.
If I open a remote file (on the private network \172.28.26.*) treeview sees all the files and folders, when I click on a file it opens a tab but doesn't load any text (blank)
If I map the remote folder ad a network drive (on I:/) and I open the same directory, files load correctly.

This patch forces the `isFoldedAtCursorRow` method to return false if there's no cursor available.
